intro: Hieracium brevifurcum, commonly known as the short-haired hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Its flowers are yellow, appearing in clusters at the top of the stems, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium brevifurcum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
